archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Jerk Chicken & Black Bean Coconut Rice Bowls
description: Fiery jerk-style chicken over coconut rice with limey black beans and peppers. Caribbean heat meets Mexican staples in a fast family bowl.
prep_steps: Dice chicken thighs into bite-size pieces; pat dry.
Slice onion and bell peppers into thin strips.
Chop coriander and cut lime into wedges; squeeze 1 lime for juice.
If using an outdoor grill, preheat to high. If using stovetop, place a large skillet over medium-high heat.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix olive oil, minced habanero peppers, garlic, allspice, cumin, lime juice, and salt. Toss in chicken to coat.
Grill or pan-sear chicken in a single layer until browned and cooked through, 6–8 minutes, turning once. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet (or a grill-safe pan), add a little more olive oil if needed and cook onion and bell peppers with a pinch of salt until tender-crisp, 3–4 minutes. Remove from heat.
Warm coconut rice in a covered pot over low heat with a splash of water, 3–4 minutes, fluffing occasionally.
In a small pot, warm black beans over medium heat with a splash of water and hot sauce; simmer 2–3 minutes and season with a pinch of salt.
Assemble bowls: coconut rice, black beans, peppers and onions, and jerk chicken. Top with coriander and extra hot sauce if desired. Serve with lime wedges.

ingredients.preparation: juiced, plus wedges from an additional lime if desired

final_ingredients.preparation: juiced, plus wedges from an additional lime if desired
